title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1400.1 - Application
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1400.1 - Application

State Regulations

This Part shall apply to all attorneys
who, on or after November 30, 1993, undertake to represent a client in a claim, action or proceeding, or preliminary to the filing of a claim, action or
proceeding, in either Supreme Court or Family Court, or in any court of
appellate jurisdiction, for divorce, separation, annulment, custody, visitation, maintenance, child support, or alimony, or to enforce or modify a
judgment or order in connection with any such claims, actions or proceedings. This Part shall not apply to attorneys representing clients without
compensation paid by the client, except that where a client is other than a
minor, the provisions of section
1400.2
of this Part shall apply to
the extent they are not applicable to compensation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1400.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
